channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Deformable Model Driven Neural Rendering for High-fidelity 3D Reconstruction of Human Heads Under Low-View Settings
item.description: We represent 3D human heads as the zero level-set of a composed signed distance field that consists of a smooth template, a non-rigid deformation, and a high-frequency displacement field.

item.title: GP-VTON: Towards General Purpose Virtual Try-on via Collaborative Local-Flow Global-Parsing Learning
item.description: Specifically, compared with the previous global warping mechanism, LFGP employs local flows to warp garments parts individually, and assembles the local warped results via the global garment parsing, resulting in reasonable warped parts and a semantic-correct intact garment even with challenging inputs. On the other hand, our DGT training strategy dynamically truncates the gradient in the overlap area and the warped garment is no more required to meet the boundary constraint, which effectively avoids the texture squeezing problem.

item.title: Improved Adversarial Training Through Adaptive Instance-wise Loss Smoothing
item.description: We find that during training an overall reduction of adversarial loss is achieved by sacrificing a considerable proportion of training samples to be more vulnerable to adversarial attack, which results in an uneven distribution of adversarial vulnerability among data.

item.title: Accelerating Vision-Language Pretraining with Free Language Modeling
item.description: FLM successfully frees the prediction rate from the tie-up with the corruption rate while allowing the corruption spans to be customized for each token to be predicted.

item.title: Error Analysis Prompting Enables Human-Like Translation Evaluation in Large Language Models: A Case Study on ChatGPT
item.description: Our results indicate that by combining Chain-of-Thoughts and Error Analysis, a new prompting method called \textbf{\texttt{Error Analysis Prompting}}, LLMs like ChatGPT can \textit{generate human-like MT evaluations at both the system and segment level}.

item.title: UniTS: A Universal Time Series Analysis Framework with Self-supervised Representation Learning
item.description: Machine learning has emerged as a powerful tool for time series analysis.

item.title: 2PCNet: Two-Phase Consistency Training for Day-to-Night Unsupervised Domain Adaptive Object Detection
item.description: Object detection at night is a challenging problem due to the absence of night image annotations.

item.title: Hard Sample Matters a Lot in Zero-Shot Quantization
item.description: Nonetheless, we find that the synthetic samples constructed in existing ZSQ methods can be easily fitted by models.

item.title: Particle Mean Field Variational Bayes
item.description: The Mean Field Variational Bayes (MFVB) method is one of the most computationally efficient techniques for Bayesian inference.

item.title: Scaling Expert Language Models with Unsupervised Domain Discovery
item.description: Large language models are typically trained densely: all parameters are updated with respect to all inputs.

item.title: Zolly: Zoom Focal Length Correctly for Perspective-Distorted Human Mesh Reconstruction
item.description: As it is hard to calibrate single-view RGB images in the wild, existing 3D human mesh reconstruction (3DHMR) methods either use a constant large focal length or estimate one based on the background environment context, which can not tackle the problem of the torso, limb, hand or face distortion caused by perspective camera projection when the camera is close to the human body.

item.title: marl-jax: Multi-agent Reinforcement Leaning framework for Social Generalization
item.description: We present marl-jax, a multi-agent reinforcement learning software package for training and evaluating social generalization of the agents.

item.title: Remind of the Past: Incremental Learning with Analogical Prompts
item.description: It mimics the feature distribution of the target old class on the old model using only samples of new classes.

item.title: FishDreamer: Towards Fisheye Semantic Completion via Unified Image Outpainting and Segmentation
item.description: This paper raises the new task of Fisheye Semantic Completion (FSC), where dense texture, structure, and semantics of a fisheye image are inferred even beyond the sensor field-of-view (FoV).

item.title: Make-It-3D: High-Fidelity 3D Creation from A Single Image with Diffusion Prior
item.description: In this work, we investigate the problem of creating high-fidelity 3D content from only a single image.

item.title: Optimal Transport for Offline Imitation Learning
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Optimal Transport Reward labeling (OTR), an algorithm that assigns rewards to offline trajectories, with a few high-quality demonstrations.

item.title: Masked Scene Contrast: A Scalable Framework for Unsupervised 3D Representation Learning
item.description: As a pioneering work, PointContrast conducts unsupervised 3D representation learning via leveraging contrastive learning over raw RGB-D frames and proves its effectiveness on various downstream tasks.

item.title: HRDoc: Dataset and Baseline Method Toward Hierarchical Reconstruction of Document Structures
item.description: Moreover, we proposed an encoder-decoder-based hierarchical document structure parsing system (DSPS) to tackle this problem.

item.title: Conditional Image-to-Video Generation with Latent Flow Diffusion Models
item.description: In this paper, we propose an approach for cI2V using novel latent flow diffusion models (LFDM) that synthesize an optical flow sequence in the latent space based on the given condition to warp the given image.

item.title: StereoScene: BEV-Assisted Stereo Matching Empowers 3D Semantic Scene Completion
item.description: On top of the stereo and BEV representations, a mutual interactive aggregation (MIA) module is carefully devised to fully unleash their power.

item.title: Enhancing Multiple Reliability Measures via Nuisance-extended Information Bottleneck
item.description: In practical scenarios where training data is limited, many predictive signals in the data can be rather from some biases in data acquisition (i. e., less generalizable), so that one cannot prevent a model from co-adapting on such (so-called) "shortcut" signals: this makes the model fragile in various distribution shifts.

item.title: The ImSPOC snapshot imaging spectrometer: image formation model and device characterization
item.description: In recent years, the demand for capturing spectral information with finer detail has increased, requiring hyperspectral imaging devices capable of acquiring the required information with increased temporal, spatial and spectral resolution.

item.title: Generalist: Decoupling Natural and Robust Generalization
item.description: The parameters of base learners are collected and combined to form a global learner at intervals during the training process.

item.title: Towards Making the Most of ChatGPT for Machine Translation
item.description: We show that: 1) The performance of ChatGPT depends largely on temperature, and a lower temperature usually can achieve better performance; 2) Emphasizing the task information further improves ChatGPT's performance, particularly in complex MT tasks; 3) Introducing domain information can elicit ChatGPT's generalization ability and improve its performance in the specific domain; 4) ChatGPT tends to generate hallucinations for non-English-centric MT tasks, which can be partially addressed by our proposed prompts but still need to be highlighted for the MT/NLP community.

item.title: $k$NN Prompting: Beyond-Context Learning with Calibration-Free Nearest Neighbor Inference
item.description: In-Context Learning (ICL), which formulates target tasks as prompt completion conditioned on in-context demonstrations, has become the prevailing utilization of LLMs.

item.title: CF-Font: Content Fusion for Few-shot Font Generation
item.description: Content and style disentanglement is an effective way to achieve few-shot font generation.

item.title: Seeing Through the Glass: Neural 3D Reconstruction of Object Inside a Transparent Container
item.description: In this paper, we define a new problem of recovering the 3D geometry of an object confined in a transparent enclosure.

item.title: LINe: Out-of-Distribution Detection by Leveraging Important Neurons
item.description: In this study, from the perspective of neurons in the deep layer of the model representing high-level features, we introduce a new aspect for analyzing the difference in model outputs between in-distribution data and OOD data.

item.title: Euler Characteristic Tools For Topological Data Analysis
item.description: In this article, we study Euler characteristic techniques in topological data analysis.

item.title: ChatDoctor: A Medical Chat Model Fine-tuned on LLaMA Model using Medical Domain Knowledge
item.description: Recent large language models (LLMs) in the general domain, such as ChatGPT, have shown remarkable success in following instructions and producing human-like responses.

item.title: Principles of Forgetting in Domain-Incremental Semantic Segmentation in Adverse Weather Conditions
item.description: Deep neural networks for scene perception in automated vehicles achieve excellent results for the domains they were trained on.

item.title: Leveraging Old Knowledge to Continually Learn New Classes in Medical Images
item.description: Class-incremental continual learning is a core step towards developing artificial intelligence systems that can continuously adapt to changes in the environment by learning new concepts without forgetting those previously learned.

item.title: Best of Both Worlds: Multimodal Contrastive Learning with Tabular and Imaging Data
item.description: Medical datasets and especially biobanks, often contain extensive tabular data with rich clinical information in addition to images.

item.title: ABLE-NeRF: Attention-Based Rendering with Learnable Embeddings for Neural Radiance Field
item.description: Our method, which we call ABLE-NeRF, significantly reduces `blurry' glossy surfaces in rendering and produces realistic translucent surfaces which lack in prior art.

item.title: CCL: Continual Contrastive Learning for LiDAR Place Recognition
item.description: The experimental results show that our CCL consistently improves the performance of different methods in different environments outperforming the state-of-the-art continual learning method.

item.title: Transthoracic super-resolution ultrasound localization microscopy of myocardial vasculature in patients
item.description: Micro-vascular flow in the myocardium is of significant importance clinically but remains poorly understood.

item.title: "Get ready for a party": Exploring smarter smart spaces with help from large language models
item.description: We first explore the feasibility of a system that places an LLM at the center of command inference and action planning, showing that LLMs have the capacity to infer intent behind vague, context-dependent commands like "get ready for a party" and respond with concrete, machine-parseable instructions that can be used to control smart devices.

item.title: Decoupled Multimodal Distilling for Emotion Recognition
item.description: Specially, the representation of each modality is decoupled into two parts, i. e., modality-irrelevant/-exclusive spaces, in a self-regression manner.

item.title: Double Descent Demystified: Identifying, Interpreting & Ablating the Sources of a Deep Learning Puzzle
item.description: Double descent is a surprising phenomenon in machine learning, in which as the number of model parameters grows relative to the number of data, test error drops as models grow ever larger into the highly overparameterized (data undersampled) regime.

item.title: Query-Dependent Video Representation for Moment Retrieval and Highlight Detection
item.description: As we observe the insignificant role of a given query in transformer architectures, our encoding module starts with cross-attention layers to explicitly inject the context of text query into video representation.

item.title: Paraphrase Detection: Human vs. Machine Content
item.description: Additionally, we identify four datasets as the most diverse and challenging for paraphrase detection.

item.title: ReCOGS: How Incidental Details of a Logical Form Overshadow an Evaluation of Semantic Interpretation
item.description: We argue that this concern is realized for the COGS benchmark (Kim and Linzen, 2020).

item.title: 2D Floor Plan Segmentation Based on Down-sampling
item.description: In recent years, floor plan segmentation has gained significant attention due to its wide range of applications in floor plan reconstruction and robotics.

item.title: NeuFace: Realistic 3D Neural Face Rendering from Multi-view Images
item.description: Realistic face rendering from multi-view images is beneficial to various computer vision and graphics applications.

item.title: Online Learning for the Random Feature Model in the Student-Teacher Framework
item.description: Only when the student's hidden layer size is exponentially larger than the input dimension, an approach to perfect generalization is possible.

item.title: TRAK: Attributing Model Behavior at Scale
item.description: That is, computationally tractable methods can struggle with accurately attributing model predictions in non-convex settings (e. g., in the context of deep neural networks), while methods that are effective in such regimes require training thousands of models, which makes them impractical for large models or datasets.

item.title: Fantasia3D: Disentangling Geometry and Appearance for High-quality Text-to-3D Content Creation
item.description: Key to Fantasia3D is the disentangled modeling and learning of geometry and appearance.

item.title: Inherent Consistent Learning for Accurate Semi-supervised Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Semi-supervised medical image segmentation has attracted much attention in recent years because of the high cost of medical image annotations.

item.title: PanoVPR: Towards Unified Perspective-to-Equirectangular Visual Place Recognition via Sliding Windows across the Panoramic View
item.description: Visual place recognition has received increasing attention in recent years as a key technology in autonomous driving and robotics.

item.title: MUG: A General Meeting Understanding and Generation Benchmark
item.description: To prompt SLP advancement, we establish a large-scale general Meeting Understanding and Generation Benchmark (MUG) to benchmark the performance of a wide range of SLP tasks, including topic segmentation, topic-level and session-level extractive summarization and topic title generation, keyphrase extraction, and action item detection.
